com.embeddedunveiled.serial.nullmodem

Class SerialComNullModem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.embeddedunveiled.serial.nullmodem.SerialComNullModem

  • public final class SerialComNullModem
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides APIs to create and destroy virtual serial ports using the tty2comKm null modem emulation driver provided by this library. It follows the protocol as defined by tty2comKm driver.

    Author:
    Rishi Gupta

      • SerialComNullModem

        public SerialComNullModem(int osType)
                   throws java.io.IOException

        Create an instance of SerialComNullModem with given details.

        Parameters:
        osType - operating system this library is running on.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operating system and tty2comKm driver specific files are not found at the time this method is called.

    • Method Detail

      • createStandardLoopBackDevice

        public java.lang.String createStandardLoopBackDevice(int deviceIndex)
                                              throws java.io.IOException

        Creates a standard loop back connected virtual serial port device. If deviceIndex is -1, the next available index will be used by driver. If deviceIndex is a valid number, the given index will be used to create device node.

        For example; createStandardLoopBackDevice(2) will create /dev/tty2com2 device node in Linux or will throw exception if that number is already in use. Similarly createStandardLoopBackDevice(-1) will create /dev/tty2comXX where XX is the next free number managed by the driver internally.

        Parameters:
        deviceIndex - -1 or valid device number (0 <= deviceIndex =< 65535).
        Returns:
        Created virtual loop back device's node on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if virtual loop back device can not be created, IllegalArgumentException if deviceIndex is invalid.

      • createStandardNullModemPair

        public java.lang.String[] createStandardNullModemPair(int deviceIndex1,
                                             int deviceIndex2)
                                               throws java.io.IOException

        Creates a standard null modem connected virtual serial port device pair. If deviceIndex is -1, the next available index will be used by driver. If deviceIndex is a valid number, the given index will be used to create device nodes.

        For example; createStandardNullModemDevices(2, 3) will create /dev/tty2com2 and /dev/tty2com3 device nodes in Linux or will throw exception if any of the given number is already in use. Similarly createStandardNullModemDevices(-1, -1) will create /dev/tty2comXX and /dev/tty2comYY where XX/YY are the next free numbers managed by the driver internally.

        After calling this method it is advised to call getLastNullModemDevicePairNodes() method to get operating system specific device node name.

        Parameters:
        deviceIndex1 - -1 or valid device number (0 <= deviceIndex1 =< 65535).
        deviceIndex2 - -1 or valid device number (0 <= deviceIndex1 =< 65535).
        Returns:
        Created virtual null modem pair device's node on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if virtual null modem device pair can not be created, IllegalArgumentException if deviceIndex1/2 is invalid.

      • createCustomLoopBackDevice

        public java.lang.String createCustomLoopBackDevice(int deviceIndex,
                                          int rtsMap,
                                          int dtrMap)
                                            throws java.io.IOException

        Creates a virtual loop back device with given pin mappings.

        To connect RTS pin to CTS pin use rtsMap = SerialComNullModem.SCM_CON_CTS. A pin can be connected to one or more pins using bit mask. For example to connect RTS pin to CTS and DSR use rtsMap = SerialComNullModem.SCM_CON_CTS | SerialComNullModem.SCM_CON_DSR.

        Parameters:
        deviceIndex - -1 or valid device number (0 <= deviceIndex =< 65535).
        rtsMap - Bit mask of SerialComNullModem.SCM_CON_XXX constants as per the desired pin mappings or 0 if RTS pin should be left unconnected.
        dtrMap - Bit mask of SerialComNullModem.SCM_CON_XXX constants as per the desired pin mappings or 0 if DTR pin should be left unconnected.
        Returns:
        Created virtual loop back device's node on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation can not be completed successfully, IllegalArgumentException if invalid deviceIndex is supplied.

      • createCustomNullModemPair

        public java.lang.String[] createCustomNullModemPair(int idx1,
                                           int rtsMap1,
                                           int dtrMap1,
                                           int idx2,
                                           int rtsMap2,
                                           int dtrMap2)
                                             throws java.io.IOException

        Creates a null modem device pair with given pin mappings.

        Parameters:
        idx1 - index of 1st virtual serial port to be created.
        rtsMap1 - pin mappings definition (define how RTS pin of idx1 device should be connected to pins of idx2 device).
        dtrMap1 - pin mappings definition (define how DTR pin of idx1 device should be connected to pins of idx2 device).
        idx2 - index of 2nd virtual serial port to be created.
        rtsMap2 - pin mappings definition (define how RTS pin of idx2 device should be connected to pins of idx1 device).
        dtrMap2 - pin mappings definition (define how DTR pin of idx2 device should be connected to pins of idx1 device).
        Returns:
        Created virtual null modem pair device's node on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the null modem device node pair can not be created, IllegalArgumentException if invalid idx1/2 is supplied.

      • destroyAllVirtualDevices

        public boolean destroyAllVirtualDevices()
                                 throws java.io.IOException

        Removes all virtual serial devices created by tty2comKm driver.

        Returns:
        true on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation can not be completed due to some reason.

      • destroyVirtualLoopBackDevice

        public boolean destroyVirtualLoopBackDevice(java.lang.String deviceNode)
                                     throws java.io.IOException

        Removes the virtual loop back device created using tty2comKm driver.

        Parameters:
        deviceNode - virtual serial port to be destroyed.
        Returns:
        true on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the given device can not be deleted due to some reason, IllegalArgumentException if invalid deviceNode is supplied or deviceNode is null.

      • destroyVirtualNullModemPair

        public boolean destroyVirtualNullModemPair(java.lang.String devNode1,
                                  java.lang.String devNode2)
                                    throws java.io.IOException

        Removes the virtual null modem device pair created using tty2comKm driver. The devNode1 must be 1st device node as returned by createStandardNullModemPair() or createCustomNullModemPair() methods.

        Parameters:
        devNode1 - one of the device node of null modem pair to be destroyed.
        devNode2 - one of the device node of null modem pair to be destroyed.
        Returns:
        true on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the given device can not be deleted due to some reason, IllegalArgumentException if invalid deviceNode is supplied or devNode1/2 is null.

      • getLastLoopBackDeviceNode

        public java.lang.String getLastLoopBackDeviceNode()
                                           throws java.io.IOException

        Returns the device node of last created loop back device.

        Returns:
        Device node on success otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation can not be completed for some reason.

      • getLastNullModemDevicePairNodes

        public java.lang.String[] getLastNullModemDevicePairNodes()
                                                   throws java.io.IOException

        Returns the device nodes of last created null modem pair.

        Returns:
        Device nodes of null modem pair on success otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation can not be completed for some reason.

      • listLoopBackDevices

        public java.lang.String[] listLoopBackDevices()

        Returns list of virtual loop back devices created by tty2comKm driver and currently present in system.

        Returns:
        list of virtual loop back devices created by tty2comKm driver and currently present in system or null if no loop back device is created.

      • listNullModemDevicePairs

        public java.lang.String[] listNullModemDevicePairs()

        Returns list of virtual null modem device pairs created by tty2comKm driver and currently present in system.

        Returns:
        list of virtual null modem devices created by tty2comKm driver and currently present in system or null if no null modem pair is created.

      • emulateLineError

        public boolean emulateLineError(java.lang.String devNode,
                       int error)
                         throws java.io.IOException

        Emulate the given line error (frame, parity or overrun) on given device.

        Parameters:
        devNode - virtual serial port which will receive this error event.
        error - one of the constants SerialComNullModem.ERR_XXX.
        Returns:
        true if the given error has been emulated on given virtual serial port otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operating system specific file is not found, writing to it fails or operation can not be completed due to some reason.

      • emulateLineRingingEvent

        public boolean emulateLineRingingEvent(java.lang.String devNode,
                              boolean state)
                                throws java.io.IOException

        Emulate line ringing event on given device node.

        Parameters:
        devNode - device node which will observe ringing conditions.
        state - true if ringing event should be asserted or false for de-assertion.
        Returns:
        true on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operating system specific file is not found, writing to it fails or operation can not be completed due to some reason.

      • releaseResources

        public boolean releaseResources()
                         throws java.io.IOException

        Releases operating system specific resources acquired to carry out virtual device related operations. Applications must call this method when this class is no longer required.

        Returns:
        true on success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the resources can not be released.
